Detailed Description

The CServerListCtrl is used to display the list of servers which the user can connect to and which we request sources from.

It is a permanently sorted list in that it always ensure that the items are sorted in the correct order.

Member Function Documentation

void CServerListCtrl::AddServer ( CServer *  toadd  ) 

Adds a server to the list.

Parameters:
A pointer to the new server.

Internally this function calls RefreshServer and ShowServerCount, with the result that it is legal to add servers already in the list, though not recommended.

References RefreshServer(), and ShowServerCount().

void CServerListCtrl::HighlightServer ( const CServer *  server,
bool  highlight 
)

Sets the highlighting of the specified server.

Parameters:
server The server to have its highlighting set.
highlight The new highlighting state.

Please note that only _one_ item is allowed to be highlighted at any one time, so calling this function while another item is already highlighted will result in the old item not being highlighted any more.

References m_connected.

void CServerListCtrl::RefreshServer ( CServer *  server  ) 

Updates the displayed information on a server.

Parameters:
server The server to be updated.

This function will not only update the displayed information, it will also reposition the item should it be nescecarry to enforce the current sorting. Also note that this function does not require that the server actually is on the list already, since AddServer makes use of it, but this should generally be avoided, since it will result in the server-count getting skewed until the next AddServer call.

References CMuleListCtrl::GetInsertPos(), CMuleListCtrl::IsItemSorted(), and CMuleListCtrl::SortList().

Referenced by AddServer().

void CServerListCtrl::RemoveAllServers ( int  state = wxLIST_STATE_DONTCARE  ) 

Removes all servers with the specified state.

Parameters:
state All items with this state will be removed, default being all.

References m_connected, and ShowServerCount().

Referenced by OnRemoveServers().
